text: The 1984 UCI Track Cycling World Championships were the World Championship for track cycling. They took place in Barcelona, Catalonia, Spain in 1984.World Championship Track Cycling 2014-1893 Due to the 1984 Summer Olympics only nine events were contested, 7 for men (5 for professionals, 2 for amateurs) and 2 for women. ==Medal summary== {| |- bgcolor="#cccccc" | colspan=7 | Men's Elite Events |- |Men's keirin |Robert Dill-Bundi || Ottavio Dazzan || Urs Freuler |- |Men's sprint | Kōichi Nakano || Ottavio Dazzan || Yavé Cahard |- | |Hans-Henrik Ørsted || Tony Doyle || Jean-Luc Vandenbroucke |- |Men's points race |Urs Freuler || Gary Sutton || Henry Rinklin |- |Men's motor-paced | Horst Schütz || Max Hürzeler || Constant Tourné |- bgcolor="#cccccc" | colspan=7 | Men's Amateur Events |- |Men's motor-paced |Jan de Nijs || Roberto Dotti || Ralf Stambula |- |Men's tandem | Franck Weber Jürgen Greil || Philippe Vernet Franck Depine || Vincenzo Cecci Gabriele Sella |- bgcolor="#cccccc" | colspan=7 | Women's Events |- |Women's sprint |Connie Paraskevin |Erika Salumäe |Zhou Suying |- |Women's individual pursuit |Rebecca Twigg |Jeannie Longo |Rossella Galbiati |} ==Medal table== ==References== Track cycling Category:UCI Track Cycling World Championships by year Category:International cycle races hosted by Spain Category:1984 in track cycling Category:Sports competitions in Barcelona
title: 1984 UCI Track Cycling World Championships
